alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 6:31AM PST until March 10 at 9:30AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Tulare County in central California... * Until 930 AM PST. * At 631 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Farmersville, Exeter, Woodlake, Three Rivers, Lindcove and Lemon Cove. This includes the following streams and drainages... Jim Gray Creek, Ridenhour Creek, Kaweah River, Saint Johns River, Greasy Creek, Horse Creek, Grouse Creek, Lane Slough, South Fork Kaweah River, Dry Creek and North Fork Tule River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
